intro: Perezia alamanii var. oolepis, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family, characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves that are adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, with six petals and a central cluster of stamens. Perezia alamanii var. oolepis is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to drought conditions.
